Others have been doing it with AirTable, but the experience of lovable is definitely a lot better in this use case

posts.content:
I spend most of my time on infrastructure for Cold Email.

Why? Because it's the foundation of everything.

Your copy and perfect targeting is useless if it lands in spam due to poor deliverability.
Your Positive Reply Rate is useless if you don't have systems to reply in five minutes.

Most people obsess over copy, but cold email success starts with infrastructure. Fix the backend first, and everything else falls into place.

You should begin with infrastructure, followed by prospecting and lastly copy.

This is how we got 5 meetings in the first two weeks of working with Inagiffy. They had worked with 3 agencies before and went months without meetings, we ended up getting two calls the first day of launch. (More in the pipeline)
posts.dateRelative: 3 months ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn
posts.author: Harsh S.
posts.authorHeadline: Qualified B2B Meetings and GTM Strategies

profileData.name: Harsh S.
profileData.headline: Qualified B2B Meetings and GTM Strategies

authorInfo.name: Harsh S.
authorInfo.headline: Qualified B2B Meetings and GTM Strategies

posts.content:
We use an AirTable build out as our Master Inbox and it helps us reply within 5 minutes even with custom lead magnets.

Here's somethings you can add inside it:
1. An AI responder: It populates itself in the reply box and just needs slight tweaking before pressing send.
2. Slack notifiers: Every reply and Inbox Manager performance is tracked from it.  Get a client level daily report on Slack too. From emails sent to positive meeting to reply booked ratio.
3. A Calendar Notifier: A custom calendar to setup reminders inside the AirTable. The reminder is sent on Slack with link of the lead in the airtable.
5. Subsequences: We've automated subsequences on EmailBison our AirTable.
6. Multi Sequencer Sync: For clients yet to be moved to Bison, we've synced SmartLead inside the same Master Inbox.
7. Team Notifier: If team needs to be notified, a button with a drop down of channels on our Slack.
8. Client Notifier: If a client needs to be notified, the email is forwarded to their main email with a button.
9. Lead Magnet Generator: Every reply UI is different based on the lead magnet used for that client. For example, we're using the Google Slides x Clay integration for one client. Their Master Inbox UI has an area to add link which triggers a Clay webhook and then returns the slide link alongside.
& many more.

These automations help our inbox reply to every single  lead within 5 minutes, no matter the volume of replies. Anything else we're missing here?
posts.dateRelative: 1 month ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn
posts.author: Harsh S.
posts.authorHeadline: Qualified B2B Meetings and GTM Strategies

profileData.name: Harsh S.
profileData.headline: Qualified B2B Meetings and GTM Strategies

authorInfo.name: Harsh S.
authorInfo.headline: Qualified B2B Meetings and GTM Strategies

posts.content:
Here's how we make sure we hit the prospect's inbox every-time 

We've automated Inbox Health tracking by pulling key metrics from all inboxes into an AirTable via API. Each inbox is monitored across three critical scores:

Placement Test Score
Warmup Score
Campaign Reply Rate

None of the scores alone mean anything. You could have great inboxes but low reply rates because of copy or terrible placement tests and decent reply rates still.

By analysing these, we can quickly identify which inboxes are burnt and need replacing. Every week, we compile a list of burnt inboxes and swap them out with .info domains from Spaceship (just $2.59 each)—and yes, they work just as well as any other domain.

A simple process. No rocket science.

posts.content:
Marketing in every form requires tracking all important metrics. However, doing this manually can be one the lowest ROI tasks possible. 

For example, I track a lot of metrics for my Cold Email Lead Gen Agency including the following:

1. Automated Weekly Reporting
2. Underperforming campaigns
3. Burnt Inboxes 
4. Inbox manager Reply Time

If I were to go over these metrics manually, it would be one of the lowest ROI tasks in the business. To save myself time everyday, we've setup automations to have these delivered on a Slack channel every morning.

These among many other automations save Outreachify hours while increasing visibility.

profileData.headline: Qualified B2B Meetings and GTM Strategies

authorInfo.name: Harsh S.
authorInfo.headline: Qualified B2B Meetings and GTM Strategies

posts.content:
Your cold email game is only as strong as your workflows.

I’ve seen this firsthand while building reliable client acquisition systems for B2B companies. 

You can have great deliverability, sharp scripts, and verified leads, but if your follow-up game is weak, you’re leaving results on ice. Don't let any one factor bring you down.

Here’s how we approach workflows and keep prospects engaged: 

Once someone books, we trigger workflows that send call confirmations paired with sales assets like videos or case studies. These aren’t just extra steps, they keep leads warm and excited about showing up. 

Next, we set up reminder sequences: one goes out at least every day leading up, another hits two hours before, and one final nudge lands just before go-time. This drastically reduces no-shows. 

But workflows don’t stop there. Weekly reviews are non-negotiable. We analyze everything: inbox sentiment, script performance, and lead quality. 

If positive replies aren’t converting, we tweak CTAs. If deliverability dips, we score accounts using tools like EmailGuard and swap out burnt inboxes. 

This process ensures every part works together seamlessly. Cold email is optimization missing even one piece can sink your system. That’s why we test, refine, and scale what’s working. 

Want your cold email efforts actually driving results? Book a call for a free consultation to book meetings.

posts.content:
22 meetings in two days for Inagiffy. Here’s what worked:

Systems – This campaign ran from Monday to Wednesday, and we had 43 interested leads to reply to within five minutes. If we didn’t have solid systems in place, we’d have burned through leads fast. The key was having a process to handle the volume while also responding to objections in under five minutes. Speed is everything in outbound. Leverage AI lead magnets, custom inbox managers and Slack notifiers.

Copywriting – Personalisation isn’t about knowing their favourite coffee shop. It’s about showing effort. Prospects like it when they notice when you put in work. Even a tiny detail, like a mention of their ICP or a competitor can make a massive difference. If your email feels like there was some sort of effort for the prospect, they’re way more likely to respond.

Niche & Case Study – We went after a relatively new niche, and the client had a killer case study. That combo made things easy. Every company we reached out to in the US already knew the brand in the case study, which meant trust was built before we even started talking. If your niche is untapped and you have proof you can deliver, you’re golden.

Good systems, solid case study, and the right offer. Get these right, and booking meetings gets a whole lot easier.

posts.content:
Your Cold Email Campaigns can cost your clients thousands of dollars.

Cold outreach can be powerful, but staying compliant is key to protecting your sender reputation and avoiding legal trouble. 

Here’s how to ensure your outreach is effective and risk-free:

1️⃣ Sync SmartLead with Clay to auto-remove uninterested prospects.

2️⃣ Skip the unsubscribe link—use "Reply with 'Not Interested'" instead.

3️⃣ Add a proper email signature for credibility and compliance.

4️⃣ Know the laws (GDPR, TCPA, CAN-SPAM) to avoid trouble.

Follow these compliance tips to keep your emails landing in the right inboxes.

Additionally, if you’re struggling to find clients for your B2B company.

We will take care of it! Book a call with me today from the link in bio.

posts.content:
I see a lot of discussions and webinars ondeliverability for hours. You don't need to spend hours studying and discussing to have great deliverability with Cold Emails

You can have 5% with just these - 
1. Great Inbox Providers (Cheap Inboxes, Premium Inboxes, ScaledMail)
2. Spintax
3. Open Rate and Click Rate turned off (Can't believe I have to mention this)
4. Under 50 words
5. Run the script through a Spam Checker (I use EmailGuard)
6. Placement Tests on weekends with EmailGuard
7. Not have a terrible offer that everyone marks you as spam

It makes no sense to test any angle, CTA or subject line until you hit the inbox - get sorted on this front first.

posts.content:
Here's how we manage deliverability at Outreachify

Every weekend we run placement tests for all inboxes

Based off the results, we simply divide them in different campaigns separated by the ESP of the leads

No ESP matching, reverse ESP matching or shooting in the dark

Simply, where the specific inbox delivers, send it there

We have SOPs and workflows, and are doing it as a service for other Lead Gen Agencies too

We also make sure to keep the copy of placement tests similar to our actual copy as that can affect results

Not everything should complicated, just send where it delivers

profileData.name: Harsh S.
profileData.headline: Qualified B2B Meetings and GTM Strategies

authorInfo.name: Harsh S.
authorInfo.headline: Qualified B2B Meetings and GTM Strategies

posts.content:
Here’s how we use SL + EmailGuard placement tests to automate email deliverability:

Categorize Campaigns by ESPs
Start by sorting campaigns based on the email service provider inside the AirTable(Google Workspace or Microsoft). This helps target performance more effectively.
While listing email accounts in Airtable, pick the campaign type (e.g., MS or GW). This makes sure EmailGuard tracks them accurately.


Run Placement Tests
Launch placement tests with as many inboxes as you need—some manage thousands at once! After the tests, pull the results from EmailGuard.
Pro Tip: Include subject lines and email bodies from Airtable. This way, the test also checks your messaging for spam risks, not just email health.

Review Results & Automate Actions
EmailGuard results are displayed in Airtable as health percentages for GW and MS campaigns separately.
Example: If 4/4 emails land in the inbox for Google, that’s a 100% score.
Set a cutoff (e.g., 75%). Inboxes scoring below that are automatically removed from the campaign.

Reintegrate After Warming Up
Removed inboxes go through a warm-up phase. After a week, run placement tests again. If their scores improve, they’re added back to the campaign automatically.

This system keeps your campaigns sending only from healthy inboxes—no matter how many accounts you’re managing.

If you're in a market with a low TAM, it's extremely important to have systems to make sure every mailbox is delivering to the inbox. You must be doing this -

1. Inbox placement tests running on automation every weekend
2. Results from placements in a detailed view
3. Deleting burnt inboxes as every email that lands in spam is an important lead wasted

We've been doing this on automation for weeks and seen up to 2-5x increase in deliverability compared to just shooting in the dark. 

We've set it up for many others doing as many as 5K inbox placement tests at once. Going to make this along with other automations we've helped others setup live as a service soon under outreachify.io/automate.

posts.content:
Creating Winning Copies for your Cold Email campaigns is not a rocket science. Yet everyone seems to be screwing it up. 

Here's a quick framework we use at Outreachify to consistently craft high-
performing email copy:

1️⃣ Skip Templates:

Templates are often impersonal and overused. Instead, create 10 unique versions of your email, mixing personalized and general options. Take inspiration but keep it original!

2️⃣ Focus on Simple Wins:

Use tools like ChatGPT to rephrase your copy, simplify it to a 5th-grade reading level, and ensure clarity. Simpler copy = better results.

3️⃣ Test and Improve:

Run A/B tests with 500–1,000 leads per version. Identify the top 3–4 winning angles, and keep iterating. 

Remember to test new ideas alongside proven ones for continued success.

Are you struggling to find clients for your B2B business? 

Let me help you out. Book a call today - Link in Bio!

#ColdEmailTips #B2BMarketing #EmailMarketingStrategy #Outreachify

posts.content:
I have been running cold email campaigns for a while and I can safely say your landing page makes a HUGE difference in your conversions

There's a common misconception that spending time on your Landing Page is shiny object syndrome

It's a huge mistake to neglect this, as the first thing a lead does after reading your cold email is check out your website

That's literally the reason we set up domain redirects

If you've spent time analysing your replies on your cold email campaigns, you'd often notice they had a look at your LP 

Noticed a huge difference in my own campaigns after I had my LP redesigned (outreachify.io)

posts.content:
For a long time, I believed that using random names in cold emails was best for deliverability. But over time, I’ve realized that using your real name makes a real difference.

When prospects look you up and find your LinkedIn or other socials, it builds trust—just like a high-converting landing page does for outbound.
I’ve seen random names being recommended often, but based on data, the impact has been different for me.

Unless you have zero social presence (no LinkedIn, etc.), your real name can be a game-changer.

posts.content:
At Outreachify, we've been doubling down on making data and reporting a priority lately.

Right now, we are:
Building Airtable dashboards to keep everything organized and easy to understand.
Working with a data analytics expert to make sure we’re digging into the right numbers.
Setting up automations so clients always have the updates they need without having to ask.

I’ll be dropping a video soon to show how it all comes together—stay tuned!

The tools we're using for this are -
Smartlead for data
Make to automate and send data
Airtable for UI 
Slack and Mail for Client Reporting

posts.content:
Excited to share that my new website is officially live! 🚀

You can check it out here: outreachify.io.

This site represents the next step in showcasing what we do best at Outreachify – helping businesses connect with their ideal clients through tailored and effective outreach strategies.

I’d love to hear your thoughts! Whether it’s feedback on the design, content, or overall experience, your input is invaluable.

If you have any suggestions for additional sections or improvements, feel free to drop them in the comments.

Outreachify
